code: newbfi <- psych::bfi %>% head(50) %>% auto_score("A") #>  #> Adding scores for the A scale. #>  #> =============================================================== #>  #> ---------------------------------------------------Testing keys #> Reliability analysis    #>  raw_alpha std.alpha G6(smc) average_r  S/N   ase mean  sd median_r #>       0.22      0.32    0.49     0.074 0.48 0.093   18 2.1    0.082 #>  #> ------------------------------------------------Possible drops? #>     raw_alpha   std.alpha   G6(smc)    average_r         S/N   alpha se #> age 0.6401512  0.42544464 0.5372606  0.128992138  0.74047631 0.08165305 #> A4  0.2039064  0.14481064 0.3925876  0.032756976  0.16933167 0.08524789 #> A3  0.2014994  0.06413355 0.2829761  0.013520398  0.06852852 0.08112586 #> A2  0.1909211  0.20247520 0.3839429  0.048322292  0.25387950 0.09053765 #> A5  0.1579202 -0.05038375 0.1406805 -0.009686323 -0.04796699 0.08427459 #> A1- 0.1088703  0.59798114 0.6158001  0.229280612  1.48744546 0.10018208 #>          var.r      med.r #> age 0.10907797 0.18432965 #> A4  0.12024568 0.02179296 #> A3  0.08593675 0.05261349 #> A2  0.08927665 0.02029358 #> A5  0.05296728 0.02029358 #> A1- 0.04319743 0.19797873 #>  #> ---------------------------------------------------Calculating scale #> Call: psych::scoreItems(keys = keys, items = data_set, min = 1, max = 6) #>  #> (Unstandardized) Alpha: #>          A #> alpha 0.22 #>  #> Standard errors of unstandardized Alpha: #>          A #> ASE   0.13 #>  #> Average item correlation: #>               A #> average.r 0.044 #>  #> Median item correlation: #>    A  #> 0.27  #>  #>  Guttman 6* reliability:  #>             A #> Lambda.6 0.32 #>  #> Signal/Noise based upon av.r :  #>                 A #> Signal/Noise 0.27 #>  #> Scale intercorrelations corrected for attenuation  #>  raw correlations below the diagonal, alpha on the diagonal  #>  corrected correlations above the diagonal: #>      A #> A 0.22 #>  #>  Average adjusted correlations within and between scales (MIMS) #> [1] 0.04 #>  #>  Average adjusted item x scale correlations within and between scales (MIMT) #> [1] 0.43 #>  #>  In order to see the item by scale loadings and frequency counts of the data #>  print with the short option = FALSE #> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> #> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

title: hcictools
code: test_data <- tibble::tibble(     ResponseId = 1:nrow(psych::bfi),     `Duration (in seconds)` = stats::rnorm(nrow(psych::bfi), mean = 100, sd = 50),     psych::bfi)     careless_indices(test_data,                     duration_column = "Duration (in seconds)",                     id_column = "ResponseId",                     likert_vector = c(3:28)) %>% head()

It detects inverse coding using the psych::alpha function. — auto_score

Detect careless responses — careless_indices
text: function detect careless survey responses using careless package. big improvement subject bounds individual criterions (speeders, longstring, average longstring inter response variance) automatically excluded calculation inter-individual criterions (psychometric synonyms, psychometric antonyms Mahananobis Distance).

title: Detect careless responses — careless_indices
code: careless_indices(   dat,   likert_vector = NULL,   id_column = "ResponseId",   duration_column = "Duration (in seconds)",   speeder_analysis = "median/2",   critval_longstring = FALSE,   critval_avgstring = FALSE,   critval_irv_low = FALSE,   critval_irv_high = FALSE,   antonyms = TRUE,   critval_ant = -0.6,   synonyms = TRUE,   critval_syn = 0.6,   mahaD = TRUE )

title: Detect careless responses — careless_indices
text: dat data.frame contains survey data. likert_vector vector containing numeric addresses numeric likert items dat. Leaving parameter NULL (default) still allows speeder analysis. id_column string contains name id column. default use "ResponseId", used Qualtrics. duration_column string contains name column duration survey responses. default use Duration (seconds), used Qualtrics. speeder_analysis criterion test speeders. speeder_analysis parameter can one following: median, median/2 (default), median/3, numeric value directly used threshold. Using FALSE ignore speeder analysis. critval_longstring numeric threshold longstring analysis. Longstrings flagged considered analysis. critval_avgstring numeric threshold average longstring analysis. Average longstrings flagged considered analysis. critval_irv_low numeric lower threshold inter response variance analysis. IRV flagged considered analysis. critval_irv_high numeric upper threshold inter response variance analysis. IRV flagged considered analysis. antonyms psychometric antonyms calculated? critval_ant Threshold antonym analysis (Default: -0.6) synonyms psychometric synonyms calculated? critval_syn Threshold antonym analysis (Default: 0.6) mahaD Whether test mahalanobis distance confidence 0.99. (Default: TRUE)

title: Detect careless responses — careless_indices
